channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Payroll to the People
item.description: Paycom has created Beti, which can further streamline the payroll process by empowering employees to do their own payroll.  And not to get all “ACT NOW” on you, but if you’re waiting until employees ask for employee-driven payroll, it’s already too late. So why keep doing payroll the less-efficient way? Free of FrustrationBy giving employees the tools they need to take control of their payroll processes, you give them the power to prevent frustrating or time-consuming follow-ups if their paycheck is wrong. But now, the thought of a company or brand not having an app seems even more foreign.
item.author: Morning Brew

item.title: Stock Watch: New Olympic Sports
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Icebreakers with...Fashion Icon and Now CEO Stacy London
item.description: The amount that I have learned is like, I didn't know it was possible. Wear what you want. What do I know about running a company? Is there an item of clothing or accessory that you think everyone should have in their closet? I don't think in my entire career there's ever been a time where I was afraid to be vulnerable with my own struggles. But what I really think is that you can wear what you want and get what you want if you understand how style can help you control the narrative of yourself. we just want to talk).  But we've stopped looking for expertise, and we are looking for shared experience. I am. Are you a breakfast person? Both of them have sweet matcha that's not too sweet.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 24
item.description: (The Ringer) Read: The resurgent appeal of Guinness world records. Cooper’s podcast became exclusive to Spotify this week after she signed a $60 million contract with the streamer.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Snap Soars as Social Media Evolves to New Era of Creators and Commerce
item.description: In a previous earnings report, CEO Evan Spiegel said that easing Covid restrictions boosted Story posting and engagement with Snap Map.Strong advertising performance: Snap’s improvements to its ad offerings, paired with more brands putting money into digital ads during the pandemic, has meant advertisers are willing to pay more for placement on its platforms.  The social media company’s stock catapulted nearly 25% the day after reporting its biggest growth quarter in four years. That’s translated into mega revenue growth.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The Olympics May Have Been Rescheduled, But The 2020 Logo Doesn’t Know That
item.description: Despite the fact that it is very much the year 2021, all Olympic marketing materials, from the TV ads to the gold medals, are stamped with the “Tokyo 2020” logo. One can only imagine the underground market that would have erupted for “Tokyo 2020” merch. Like your old high school friend who constantly brings up his state football championship, the Tokyo Olympics are living in the past. A decision to keep the original branding was made last March, when Japan and the International Olympic Committee agreed to postpone the Summer games for the first time in history.  The real reason Tokyo 2020 didn’t become Tokyo 2021 is because a change would have been supremely expensive.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Boston Beer, Maker of Truly Hard Seltzer, Says Hard Seltzer Party Is Over
item.description: Shares in Boston Beer, the company that makes Truly hard seltzer, collapsed 27% yesterday after it warned the seltzer party was over.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 23
item.description: Quote: “I think we will effectively transition from people seeing us as primarily being a social media company to being a metaverse company.” (Object of Sound)
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Startup Announces Breakthrough Technology for Energy Storage
item.description: Form’s batteries may be key to achieving President Biden’s goal of a carbon-free power grid in the US by 2035. Form Energy, a startup backed by Bill Gates and Jeff Bezos, might have cracked the code: batteries made from iron that can hold electricity for days or even weeks.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: The Housing Market Frenzy May Have Peaked
item.description: Yes, the US median house price did hit a record high of $363,300 last month, up 22.9% from a year earlier. Before you offer $100k over asking price on a new home, you should hear this: The boiling US housing market took a refreshing dip in the pool in June.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: California Sues Gaming Company Activision Blizzard
item.description: California legislators sued video game developer Activision Blizzard yesterday, citing its “pervasive ‘frat boy’ culture” and mistreatment of women employees. The suit details that one female employee died by suicide on a corporate trip after nude photos were leaked and shared among male colleagues who had previously harassed her. Bottom line: The lawsuit against Activision Blizzard shows that the #MeToo movement is still reaching its crescendo in the video game industry.  Ubisoft (Assassin’s Creed, Far Cry) was accused of rampant sexism and racism last summer. Denial on all fronts. Activision’s response?
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: The Business Olympiad
item.description: Work Softwarathon  Toby Howell This is by far the most organized event in the Olympiad which makes it one of the more intriguing. 10 Events, 90 participants, and everything to play for, the Business Olympiad will see the best in the biz world come together to compete for a place on the podium. and the questions the first inaugural Business Olympiad will endeavor to answer. Business Flameouts  Toby Howell This event bravely asks the question: who is the best at being the worst?   Fictional Business Freestyle Toby Howell Movies give us laughs, cries, and huge fictional megacorporations. Synchronized Businessing  Toby Howell It's hard to go at it alone in the business world.  Over the next two weeks, Morning Brew readers will have the opportunity to participate in a business competition unlike any other. They might make your skin crawl, but only one email cliche can take home the gold. Then, a second round of polls will be held to determine who stands atop the podium. Lots of mico-matchups to watch in this one from the battle of the inboxes with Outlook and Gmail, to the business communication faceoff between Slack and Teams.  Font Medley Relay Toby Howell Even if you think you don’t have an opinion on the best fonts, you do.
item.author: Toby Howell

item.title: US Housing Market Frenzy May Have Peaked
item.description: Before you offer $100k over asking price on a new home, you should hear this: The boiling US housing market took a refreshing dip in the pool in June. More owners listed their homes last month after they saw home seekers offering things like crypto in order to secure the deed.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.description: Quote: “I think we will effectively transition from people seeing us as primarily being a social media company to being a metaverse company.” (Object of Sound)

item.description: Form’s battery may be key to achieving President Biden’s goal of a carbon-free power grid in the US by 2035. Form Energy, a startup backed by Bill Gates and Jeff Bezos, might have cracked the code: batteries made from iron that can hold electricity for days or even weeks.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: California Sues Gaming Company Activision Blizzard
item.description: California legislators sued video game developer Activision Blizzard yesterday, citing its “pervasive ‘frat boy’ culture” and mistreatment of women employees. Bottom line: The lawsuit against Activision Blizzard shows that the #MeToo movement is still reaching its crescendo in the video game industry. The suit details that one woman employee died by suicide on a corporate trip after nude photos were leaked and shared among male colleagues who had previously harassed her. The detailsWomen employees were underpaid, promoted “more slowly,” and terminated “more quickly” than their male coworkers, the suit alleges.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Zed Run Developer Raises $20 Million
item.description: Meanwhile, users can win ethereum by getting on the digital race podium or by selling their horses to others at a profit. $30+ million worth of Zed horses have been sold so far. On Zed Run’s platform, 14,000+ “stable owners” (also affectionately called #ZEDheads) buy, sell, breed, and race virtual horses.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 22
item.description: Stat: US life expectancy fell by 1.5 years in 2020, the steepest drop since World War II, thanks in large part to the coronavirus. Quote: “My hope is that it creates world peace or helps create world peace.” (New Yorker)
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Olympics Opening Ceremony on Friday and How Brew Readers Are Feeling About It
item.description: In a poll of 6,000 Morning Brew readers, 42% said they’re less likely to watch the Tokyo Olympics than previous years’ Olympics. And 51% said they’re worried that the Olympics will be a superspreader event.  Covid: Should the Olympics have been canceled this year due to Covid-19 concerns? Viewership: How much of the Olympics do readers plan to watch?
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: First Look At New $26 Billion Opioid Settlement
item.description: Johnson & Johnson, a drug manufacturer accused of downplaying the addictiveness of opioids in its marketing, would shell out $5 billion over nine years. Drug overdose deaths rose nearly 30% in the US last year, to a record of 93,331.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: France Starts Mandating Vaccination for Entry to Cultural Venues
item.description: The US federal government hasn’t introduced any vaccine requirements for businesses, and it likely won’t take any steps until the FDA grants full approval to at least one of the shots. The vaccine strategy has resulted in two things:It has angered a lot of people: More than 100,000 protestors hit the streets last weekend, saying the vaccine rules infringed on their rights.   Bottom line: From $1 million lotteries to calling in Olivia Rodrigo for a PSA, US officials have offered loads of carrots to push the vaccine-hesitant to get their shots.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Zed Run Developer Raises $20 Million
item.description: Meanwhile, users can win ethereum by getting on the digital race podium or by selling their horses to others at a profit. $30+ million worth of Zed horses have been sold so far. item.title: France Starts Mandating Vaccination for Entry to Cultural Venues
item.description: The US federal government hasn’t introduced any vaccine requirements for businesses, and it likely won’t take any steps until the FDA grants full approval to at least one of the shots. The vaccine strategy has resulted in two things:It has angered a lot of people: More than 100,000 protestors hit the streets last weekend, saying the vaccine rules infringed on their rights.   Bottom line: From $1 million lotteries to calling in Olivia Rodrigo for a PSA, US officials have offered loads of carrots to push the vaccine-hesitant to get their shots.

item.title: Venmo Gets Rid of Its Public Feed
item.description: Venmo is getting rid of its public feed as part of a larger app redesign that’ll roll out over the next few weeks. The FTC cited that feature, among others, in a complaint against Venmo that was settled back in 2018.
item.author: Jamie Wilde

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 21
item.description: Victoria’s Secret CEO Martin Waters discussed the company’s shortcomings as it plans to split from parent L Brands on August 3.  Quote: “We got it wrong.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Backlash in Israel Following Ben & Jerry's Decision to Ban Sales in Occupied Territories
item.description: What happened: Ben & Jerry’s said on Monday it wouldn’t renew its contract with its licensee in Israel that distributes ice cream in Israeli-occupied territories because it was “inconsistent with our values.”
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Netflix Moves Into Video Games As Subscription Growth Slows
item.description: Bottom line: Heated competition from Disney+ and a lack of popular new shows is causing Netflix to sweat. “We view gaming as a new content category for us,” the company said. Netflix confirmed rumors it’s jumping into the gaming industry.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: So the Billionaires Went to Space. Now What?
item.description: In its big report on the space industry, Morgan Stanley identified the 10 drivers of a space economy that could grow to $1 trillion by 2040. Reality check: While space tourism news has gotten the recent buzz, it’s just a small slice of the overall space market, which is currently dominated by SpaceX. After he landed yesterday, Bezos said sales for private seats on Blue Origin flights (two more of which are planned for this year) are already approaching $100 million. Now that Bezos and Richard Branson have both completed their flights, what’s next for the space tourism industry?
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Netflix Moves Into Video Games As Subscription Growth Slows
item.description: Netflix confirmed rumors it’s jumping into the gaming industry.  Key takeaways: The company added 1.5 million new subscribers, slightly better than its 1M estimate.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Venmo Gets Rid of Its Public Feed
item.description: Venmo is getting rid of its public feed as part of a larger app redesign that’ll roll out over the next few weeks. The FTC cited that feature, among others, in a complaint against Venmo that was settled back in 2018.

item.title: So the Billionaires Went to Space. Now What?
item.description: After he landed yesterday, Bezos said sales for private seats on Blue Origin flights (two more of which are planned for this year) are already approaching $100 million. Now that Bezos and Richard Branson have both completed their flights, what’s next for the space tourism industry? Space tourism is just one of 10 drivers of the space economy that Morgan Stanley reported.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Volkswagen Is Phasing Out Sales of Passat in the US
item.description: Volkswagen said it will stop selling its Passat model in the US next year as automakers pivot to SUV production. Automakers have sent several US sedan models to the junkyard in recent years, including the Chevy Impala, Ford Focus, Dodge Dart, and Chrysler 200.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Key Performance Indicators: July 20
item.description: (Will Hoenig) Read: What is going on with Covid right now. Just wait until they find Mare of Easttown... That means calling the TV → telly, cookies → biscuits, and gas station → petrol station.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: Companies Announce IPO Plans Despite Market Sell-off
item.description: Universal Music Group: Billionaire investor Bill Ackman’s SPAC scrapped its complex deal to buy a 10% stake in UMG, which is home to artists like Taylor Swift, after the SEC squashed the idea.
item.author: Sherry Qin

item.title: Preview of Blue Origin’s First Passenger Space Flight
item.description: Jeff Bezos’s space company, Blue Origin, will launch its first human test flight at 9am ET from the small desert town of Van Horn, Texas. + The latest from Gossip Brew: While Virgin Galactic's Richard Branson might have beat Bezos to space by 10 days, he only reached an altitude of 53.5 miles.
item.author: Matty Merritt
